pageContext.title: Constitutional Regime Leadership in a World of States
pageContext.description_excerpt: This was a project of Spring 2007 MITH Winnemore Digital Dissertation Fellow Michael Evans. At the time of his fellowship, Michael's dissertation was entitled "Constitutional Regime Leadership in a World of States," and involved the use of digital technologies to analyze the public and private writings of Jefferson, Madison, and Hamilton to better establish how their core beliefs about the nature and the causes of war and peace influenced their views on constitutional design
